sentences: Ega temagi käed selles asjas päris puhtad ole!
Ja sellepärast, tüdruk, pea meeles: hoia oma kõigest puhtad, mis võiks olla sinu vastu süüdistuseks.
context: In Estonian, 'puhtad' means clean or pure. It's the plural form of the adjective 'puhas'. This word is commonly used in phrases like 'käed puhtad' (clean hands) to metaphorically refer to being innocent and not involved in anything bad or dishonest. The phrase 'hoia oma käed puhtad' literally means 'keep your hands clean' but figuratively means stay out of trouble, remain innocent, don't get involved in questionable activities.
